Usually when I launch KSP, the terrain texture will start look as it should. But after playing for several minutes or more, occasionally it glitches out and looks like this:

![L1VWL3e.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/L1VWL3e.jpg)

Compressed in one direction and stretched in another. It happens on at least Kerbin, the Mun, Eve, Duna and Moho that I've noticed. Sometimes the texture won't just be compressed/stretched but it will be shrunk down to a very small scale so that tiling is very noticeable.

I have all of my graphic settings cranked with the exception of LIGHT\_QUALITY = 8, and SHADOWS\_QUALITY = 4

Running KSP 1.0.4 on an ASUS G73Jh notebook, 

Intel Core i7 Q740 @1.73 GHz, 

8 GB ram, 

Windows 7 64-bit, 

ATI Mobility Radeon HD 5870

Any help would be great!

I see this happen fairly frequently... and just ignore it ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Terrain textures seem to reset after some scene changes (jumping to another ship or VAB)

i5 3570, 16GB, NVIDIA GTX 660, Win8.1

This issue actually makes some areas look better...

It's been reported, so if you like you can confirm this issue[**on the tracker**](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/4960), I'd personally like some variation in the ground texture X and Y values for variety.
